intro: Ginoria nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower ginoria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. Ginoria nudiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
